{{Infobox football tournament season | title = Copa del Rey | year = 1916 | other_title = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | country = Spain | num_teams = 3 | defending champions = | champions = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | runner-up = [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] | matches = 5 | goals = 29 | top goal scorer = | player = | prevseason = [[1915 Copa del Rey|1915]] | nextseason = [[1917 Copa del Rey|1917]] }} The '''Copa del Rey 1916''' was the 14th staging of the [[Copa del Rey]], the [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Association football|football]] cup competition. The competition started on March 26, 1916 and concluded on May 7, 1916 with the Final, held at the [[Camp de la IndÃºstria]] in [[Barcelona]], in which [[Athletic Bilbao]] lifted the trophy for the 7th time ever with a 4–0 victory over [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]]. It was Athletic's third title in a row, and they kept the trophy in property. ==Teams== * '''North Region''': [[Athletic Bilbao]] * '''Center Region''': [[Real Madrid|Madrid CF]] * '''South Region''': [[EspaÃ±ol de CÃ¡diz]] *'''[[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]]''': [[Real Club Fortuna de Vigo|Fortuna de Vigo]] * '''[[Catalonia]]''': [[FC Barcelona]] RC Fortuna de Vigo (champions of Galicia) and EspaÃ±ol de CÃ¡diz (champions of Andalusia) did not inscribe for the tournament. ==Semifinal== ===First leg=== {{footballbox | date = March 26, 1916 | team1 = [[FC Barcelona]] | score = 2–1 | team2 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid CF]] | stadium = [[Barcelona]] }} ===Second leg=== {{footballbox | date = April 2, 1916 | team2 = [[FC Barcelona]] | score = 4–1 | team1 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid CF]] | stadium = [[Madrid]] }} ''FC Barcelona and Madrid CF won one match each. At that year, the goal difference was not taken into account. ===First replay=== {{footballbox | date = April 13, 1916 | team2 = [[FC Barcelona]] | score = 6–6
([[Extra time|a.e.t.]]) | team1 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid CF]] | stadium = [[Madrid]] }} ===Second replay=== {{footballbox | date = April 15, 1916 | team2 = [[FC Barcelona]] | score = 4–2
([[Extra time|a.e.t.]])FC Barcelona withdrew the game seven minutes before the end of the extra time in protest for the refereeing. | team1 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid CF]] | stadium = [[Madrid]] }} ==Final== {{main|1916 Copa del Rey Final}} {{footballbox| date= 7 May 1916| time=16:00 CET| team1= [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score= 4–0 | report= | team2= [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] | goals1= Acedo {{goal|12}}
